content: cupid s mix beanie by knitosophy this simple hat makes good use of mini sock skeins or sock yarn leftovers i have made two versions of this pattern the first original version uses a set of mini skeins which is how havirland yarns used to sell the cupid s mix kit the second version uses the newer cupid s mix frankensocks kit which is comprised of 20 mini bobbins of yarn for both patterns row of color are alternated to gradually fade from one to the next and three different colors are used at a time for each pattern repeat as demonstrated in the charts provided i love the artistic and busy but not too busy look of this beanie create a color scheme you enjoy and watch the magic unfold sizes newborn 6 mos 6-12 mos toddler small medium large x-large please note the sizing for this hat is difficult to determine given the low density of fingering weight yarn the sizes run a bit big for slouchiness so if you are unsure go down a size for the mini skein version my daughter is shown wearing size large for the mini bobbin version she is wearing size medium the large fit my husband perfectly and his head circumference is 21 5 yarn 100-250 yds fingering weight yarn in 3 or more colors excludes pompom shown in havirland yarns cupid s mix mini skeins 10g/skein 2016 and mini bobbins 5g/bobbin 2017 needles 16 circulars size 2 16 circulars size 1 set of dpn s size 2 or 32 or greater circulars for magic loop notions stitch marker yarn needle gauge 30 sts = 4 inches pattern with smaller 16 circulars and brim color of your choice co 88 96 104 112 120 128 136 144 sts i used the tubular cast on for ribbing in the round search youtube videos online because cupid s mix beanie knitosophy copyright © 2016 jamie hoffman it provides a clean finished-looking edge for rib but you may use whichever method you prefer join for working in the round and pm work 2x2 ribbing for 1 1 1 1 5 1 5 2 2 2 inches meanwhile after working 6 rnds of brim begin one of the stripe patterns below following charts i and ii if using mini skeins 10-gram sections and charts iii and iv if using mini bobbins 5-gram sections switch to larger needles and work the remainder of hat in st st until hat measures 4 4 5 5 5 5 6 6 5 7 7 5 inches from cast on edge notes on charts i and ii the first 6 rnds of brim are designated as color a after the 6 rnds are complete you are ready to begin chart i round 1 of chart i begins by joining in color b after the first 15-round pattern repeat work chart ii and repeat rnds 16-30 to desired length each time chart ii is repeated color c will become color b
